content: From this post it appears that by taking the Facebook offer Antonio cost his co-founders and investors five million dollars. Considering that he could have gone to Twitter and after the lockup period joined Facebook, or done something else, this seems to be a reprehensible choice. I’ll note that I just bought the book. This post peaked my curiosity too much to resist. I want to read the story, even if I consider some of the author's choices odious. I’ve also read stories by degenerate drug addicts who stole from all of their friends and their family. I don’t approve of their choices either. Paying to read someone’s story does not mean that you condone their actions.
